law.text: The cabinet may pay the necessary traveling expenses of children committed to it for care and treatment from their homes to the institutions or homes to which they are committed, and the traveling expenses of such children from the institutions to their homes when discharged.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 331L-13.
